history.content: I think going to OH is helpful (and I believe most faculty would not have a problem with this), provided it is already not crowded by students taking the courses they are teaching. In any case, you could try emailing them to set up an appointment or expressing your concerns.

I signed up for faculty advising a bit late, and it seems like all the slots were taken up so I'm having a hard time finding someone to talk to about course enrollment. Is there anyone I can talk to for advice on choosing classes and planning out a research/career path? Would it be appropriate to just go into any professors office hours and ask for advice for example? (I'm not worried about graduation requirements or anything like that, but I'm just overwhelmed by all the options for EE/CS classes to choose from.)
history.subject: Advising on Classes?
